title: Peace Prayer of St. Francis of Assisi
Holy Spirit Prayer of St. Augustine
prayer:
Breathe in me, O Holy Spirit,
That my thoughts may all be holy.
Act in me, O Holy Spirit,
That my work, too, may be holy.
Draw my heart, O Holy Spirit,
That I love but what is holy.
Strengthen me, O Holy Spirit,
To defend all that is holy.
Guard me, then, O Holy Spirit,
That I always may be holy.

title: Tantum Ergo, St. Thomas Aquinas
My Hope, St. Therese of Lisieux
prayer:
Though in a foreign land I dwell afar,
I taste in dreams the endless joys of heaven.
Fain would I fly beyond the farthest star,
And see the wonders to the ransomed given!

No more the sense of exile weighs on me,
When once I dream of that immortal day.
To my true fatherland, dear God! I see,
For the first time Isoon shall fly away.

Ah! give me, Jesus! wings as white as snow,
That unto Thee I soon may take my flight.
I long to be where flowers unfading blow;
I long to see Thee, O my heart’s Delight!

I long to fly to Mary’s mother-arms, —
To rest upon that spotless throne of bliss;
And, sheltered there from troubles and alarms,
For the first time to feel her gentle kiss.

Thy first sweet smile of welcoming delight
Soon show, O Jesus! to Thy lowly bride;
O’ercome with rapture at that wondrous sight,
Within Thy Sacred Heart, ah! let me hide.

O happy moment! and O heavenly grace!
When I shall hear Thee, Jesus, speak to me;
And the full vision of Thy glorious Face
For the first time my longing eyes shall see.

Thou knowest well, my only martyrdom
Is love, O Heart of Jesus Christ! for Thee;
And if my soul craves for its heavenly home,
‘Tis but to love Thee more, eternally.

Above, when Thy sweet Face unveiled I view,
Measure nor bounds shall to my love be given;
Forever my delight shall seem as new
As the first time my spirit entered heaven.

title: Prayer to Saint Joseph
prayer: O Glorious Saint Joseph, faithful follower of Jesus Christ, to you do we raise our hearts and hands to implore your powerful intercession. Obtain for us from the gentle heart of Jesus all the help and graces necessary for our spiritual and temporal welfare.

title: Prayer to Saint Jude
prayer: Most holy Apostle, Saint Jude, faithful servant and friend of Jesus, the Church honors and invokes you universally as the patron of hopeless cases and of things almost despaired of. Pray for me, who am so miserable. Please bring me visible and speedy help.

title: Prayer to Saint Anthony of Padua
prayer: O Holy Saint Anthony, gentlest of Saints, your love for God and charity for His creatures made you worthy, when on earth, to possess miraculous powers. Encourage us to seek the lost and bring us closer to the peace of Christ.

title: Prayer to Saint Therese of Lisieux
prayer: O Little Flower of Jesus, ever consoling troubled souls with heavenly graces, in your unfailing intercession, help me in my trials and bring me peace, comfort, and strength.

title: Prayer to Saint Michael the Archangel
prayer: Saint Michael the Archangel, defend us in battle. Be our protection against the wickedness and snares of the Devil. May God rebuke him, we humbly pray; and do thou, O Prince of the Heavenly Host, by the power of God, thrust into hell Satan and all the evil spirits.

title: Prayer to Saint Benedict
prayer: O glorious Saint Benedict, sublime model of all virtues, pure vessel of God's grace! Behold me humbly kneeling at your feet. Intercede for me and protect me from all evil and temptation.

title: Prayer to Saint Augustine
prayer: Watch, O Lord, with those who wake, or watch, or weep tonight, and give your angels charge over those who sleep. Tend the sick, O Lord Christ. Give rest to the weary, bless the dying, soothe the suffering, pity the afflicted, shield the joyous.

title: Prayer to Saint Catherine of Siena
prayer: O admirable Saint Catherine, you served the poor and gave comfort to the sick and the dying. Grant that we may live a life of service and trust in the power of God's mercy.

title: Prayer to Saint Joan of Arc
prayer: O Holy Saint Joan of Arc, patroness of soldiers and of France, watch over us in our daily battles. Help us to overcome the obstacles we face and lead us to victory in life with courage, strength, and faith.

title: Prayer to Saint Joseph
prayer: O Glorious Saint Joseph, faithful follower of Jesus Christ,
to you do we raise our hearts and hands to implore your powerful intercession.
Obtain for us from the gentle heart of Jesus all the help and graces necessary
for our spiritual and temporal welfare.

title: Prayer to Saint Jude
prayer: Most holy Apostle, Saint Jude, faithful servant and friend of Jesus,
the Church honors and invokes you universally as the patron of hopeless cases.
Pray for me, who am so miserable.
Please bring me visible and speedy help.

title: Prayer to Saint Anthony of Padua
prayer: O Holy Saint Anthony, gentlest of Saints,
your love for God and charity for His creatures made you worthy to possess miraculous powers.
Encourage us to seek the lost and bring us closer to the peace of Christ.

title: Prayer to Saint Francis of Assisi
prayer: Lord, make me an instrument of your peace.
Where there is hatred, let me sow love;
Where there is injury, pardon;
Where there is doubt, faith;
Where there is despair, hope;

title: Prayer to Saint Therese of Lisieux
prayer: O Little Flower of Jesus,
ever consoling troubled souls with heavenly graces,
in your unfailing intercession, help me in my trials,
and bring me peace, comfort, and strength.

title: Prayer to Saint Michael the Archangel
prayer: Saint Michael the Archangel, defend us in battle.
Be our protection against the wickedness and snares of the Devil.
May God rebuke him, we humbly pray;
and do thou, O Prince of the Heavenly Host,
by the power of God, thrust into hell Satan and all evil spirits.

title: Prayer to Saint Benedict
prayer: O glorious Saint Benedict, sublime model of all virtues,
pure vessel of God's grace!
Behold me humbly kneeling at your feet.
Intercede for me and protect me from all evil and temptation.

title: Prayer to Saint Augustine
prayer: Watch, O Lord, with those who wake, or watch, or weep tonight,
and give your angels charge over those who sleep.
Tend the sick, O Lord Christ.
Give rest to the weary, bless the dying,
soothe the suffering, pity the afflicted, shield the joyous.

title: Prayer to Saint Catherine of Siena
prayer: O admirable Saint Catherine,
you served the poor and gave comfort to the sick and the dying.
Grant that we may live a life of service
and trust in the power of God's mercy.

title: Prayer to Saint Joan of Arc
prayer: O Holy Saint Joan of Arc, patroness of soldiers and of France,
watch over us in our daily battles.
Help us to overcome the obstacles we face,
and lead us to victory in life with courage, strength, and faith.

title: Prayer to Saint Padre Pio
prayer: O Saint Padre Pio, holy bearer of the wounds of Christ,
accept us this day as your spiritual sons and daughters
and keep us always on the path to salvation.
Intercede for us and obtain our requests through Jesus Christ.

title: Prayer to Saint Bernadette
prayer: O gentle Saint Bernadette,
you endured so much with humility and trust in God's plan.
Help us to remain faithful in suffering,
and to draw nearer to Christ through prayer and love.

title: Prayer to Saint Dominic
prayer: O glorious Saint Dominic,
preacher of the Rosary and light of the Church,
teach us to seek truth and defend it with charity,
that we may live as joyful witnesses to the Gospel.

title: Prayer to Saint Elizabeth Ann Seton
prayer: O Saint Elizabeth Ann Seton,
you were a woman of faith, courage, and service.
Help us to follow your example,
by trusting in God and caring for those in need.

title: Prayer to Saint Teresa of Avila
prayer: Let nothing disturb you,
Let nothing frighten you,
All things are passing away:
God never changes.
Patience obtains all things.
Whoever has God lacks nothing;
God alone suffices.

title: Prayer to Saint Ignatius of Loyola
prayer: Take, Lord, and receive all my liberty,
my memory, my understanding, and my entire will,
All I have and call my own.
You have given all to me; to you, Lord, I return it.
Everything is yours; do with it what you will.
Give me only your love and your grace; that is enough for me.

title: Prayer to Saint John Vianney
prayer: Saint John Vianney, patron of parish priests,
your life was one of humble service and holiness.
Intercede for our priests and all who serve the Church,
that they may lead souls with zeal and compassion.

title: Prayer to Saint Kateri Tekakwitha
prayer: Saint Kateri, Lily of the Mohawks,
you embraced the cross and followed Christ in purity and faith.
Guide us to live with courage and devotion,
even when faced with rejection or hardship.

title: Prayer to Saint Monica
prayer: Saint Monica, patient mother of Saint Augustine,
you never ceased praying for the conversion of your son.
Help us to persevere in prayer for our loved ones,
trusting in God's timing and mercy.

title: Prayer to Saint Raphael the Archangel
prayer: Saint Raphael, angel of healing and guidance,
lead us on our journey and protect us from all harm.
Heal our physical and spiritual wounds,
and bring us safely to our destination.
